Text.Value: A little more than that.
Lord Gortash warned there would be doubters. Where there is genius, there are always sceptics.
You'll see for yourself soon enough if you head to the city.
Don't tell me where I can and can't go.
Look pal, faith or no, the sooner the Steel Watch replaces me the better.
It's my job to do exactly that. If you intend to spend any time in Baldur's Gate, you best learn some respect for the Flaming Fist.
I prefer guards with actual faith in what they're protecting.
Luckily for you, the Steel Watchers protect all law-abiding citizens equally.
And trust me, you don't want to go out there.
Thank Lord Gortash. No doubt we'll be needing them again before too long. You be safe now.
You've had the pleasure of meeting one? Then you know the city's in good hands.
Steel Watch - is that some sort of fancy new rank of city watchman?
Turn back, citizen. No passage in this direction.
I appreciate the company, but I really should be on my guard.
Head to the city why don't you? There'll be plenty more there to interest you than here, I'm sure.
Still can't let you through, I'm afraid. Commanding officer's orders.
Way I see it, city's got a whole lot safer since the Steel Watch showed up. For that, we can thank Lord Gortash.
The cultists assaulted the gate, armed to the teeth, trying to break in.
Thank the gods for the Steel Watch.
Why not?
With ease. They could stop a dragon.
I take it the Steel Watch won?
Sounds like the battle's over then.
Leave.
There's no reason for me stick my neck out against armies of cultists when we can send mountains of steel instead.
Leave.
Be careful of the Steel Watch. They're not the salvation you think they are.
They nearly had it too, before the Steel Watch intervened.
Those Steel Watchers sure do get around.
For now. But I can't let you pass - we might have repelled an advance party, but they'll strike again.
Way I see it, the city's a whole lot safer since the Steel Watch showed up. And we can thank the late Lord Gortash for that.
Ah, you're one of those.
It's bloodier than a butcher's backyard out there. Piles of dead Absolutists, and a few of our own as well.

Synopsis: A dialog of a FF guarding southern gates of Rivington near the battlefield.
